greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n occurs n times, as early as possible subject to the constraint that two successive occurrences of n are separated by at least by n terms.
comment: Subsidiary sequences: first (A100919) and the last (A100920) occurrences of n.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Index of the first occurrence of 2 is 2 and that of the second occurrence is 5, separated by a(3) and a(4), two terms.
mathematica: mx = 22; lst = cnt = ConstantArray[0, mx + 1]; a = {}; Do[k = Min@Select[Range[mx + 1], lst[[#]] <= n && cnt[[#]] < # &]; AppendTo[a, k]; lst[[k]] = n + k + 1; cnt[[k]]++; If[k > mx, Break[]], {n, mx^2}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, Nov 25 2016 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Dec 05 2004
